main event: A bright-colored (golden) object with a long, thin, tail-like appendage was observed moving slowly and steadily over Dallas, Texas on January 10, 1965.
interesting points: The object traveled straight and level for 15 seconds before disappearing into the horizon.
A group of North Texas University students observed a large object with only navigation lights for about 6 minutes, and it appeared to be the size of the full moon.
The object moved very slowly, may have been hovering, and changed direction from straight to the right and then straight again.
The object appeared to move faster than an airplane and did not deviate from a straight course, which seemed to defy the laws of physics for a star or airplane.
The object was not a reported 'star' in that area and did not behave like an artificial satellite.
sighted object: Bright-colored (golden) object with a long, thin, tail-like appendage; Large object with only navigation lights
